channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MS

item.title: Report X-2024020778
item.description:
Report X-2024020778

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was in Gateway area, inside container AMJ 66240 FX. The package was already wet from internal leakage. Two caps were slightly loosened. DescribePack: The package had begun to tear, due to the over absorption of the hazardous material. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside a plastic bag and had absorbed majority of the hazardous material.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND IN THE QA AREA INSIDE OF A NON-HAZARDOUS TOTE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS COMPLETELY DESTROYED. THE LEAKAGE WAS ABSORBED THROUGHTOUT THE CARDBOARD BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKGE WAS PROPERLY HANDLED USING THE CORRECT HAZARDOUS SPILL EQUIPMENT.

item.title: Report X-2024021101
item.description:
Report X-2024021101

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was in trailer56848 on door 52. The manager informed me that the package was already damaged, when he opened the trailer. The content cap was loose causing internal leakage. DescribePack: The content cap was loosened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Oil dry was used to absorb the spill.

item.title: Report X-2024020728
item.description:
Report X-2024020728

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package contained 4 1-gallon plastic bottles of Rapicide. One of the bottles has a loose cap and leaked corrosive liquid and destroyed side of the box. DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Collected package from van line and brought down to QA area to process damage.
